ingredients.title: Absinthe Herb
ingredients.description: A bitter aromatic herb used historically in absinthe liqueur. Known medically as a digestive bitter and vermifuge.
ingredients.usages: Digestive stimulant, appetite enhancer, anti-parasitic, menstrual regulation
ingredients.safetyClassification: Caution - thujone is neurotoxic in high doses; avoid in pregnancy
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Tea: 1-2g dried herb per cup, 1-2x daily max. Tincture: 10-20 drops before meals.

ingredients.title: Acacia
ingredients.description: A gum-producing tree/shrub. The gum (gum arabic) is used as a demulcent and emulsifier.
ingredients.usages: Soothing irritated mucous membranes, binding agent, mild astringent for diarrhea
ingredients.safetyClassification: Generally Recognized As Safe (GRAS) for food use
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Gum: 5-30g daily in divided doses. Powder: 1-5g mixed in water.

ingredients.title: Acacia (powdered)

ingredients.title: Activated Charcoal
ingredients.description: Highly porous carbon used to adsorb toxins. Medically used for poisoning and overdose treatment.
ingredients.usages: Acute poisoning treatment, gas/bloating relief, water filtration
ingredients.activeConstituents: Pure carbon with high surface area
ingredients.safetyClassification: Safe for acute use; may interfere with medication absorption
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Poisoning: 50-100g single dose (medical supervision). Gas: 500mg-1g after meals.

ingredients.title: Adhatoda

ingredients.safetyClassification: Avoid in pregnancy (uterine stimulant); use under practitioner guidance
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Leaf juice: 10-20ml. Powder: 1-3g. Decoction: 50-100ml twice daily.

ingredients.safetyClassification: Generally safe; limited safety data available
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Fresh rhizome: 2-5g chewed or decocted. Powder: 1-2g daily.

ingredients.title: Yarrow (chewed/crushed)
ingredients.description: A wound-healing herb used for bleeding, fever, and digestive complaints.
ingredients.usages: Wounds, heavy menstrual bleeding, fever, colds, digestive complaints
ingredients.safetyClassification: Avoid in pregnancy; may cause allergic reactions in Asteraceae-sensitive individuals
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Dried herb: 2-4g as tea. Tincture: 2-4ml 3x daily. Topical: as poultice.

ingredients.title: Yellow Dock
ingredients.description: A bitter root used for constipation, skin conditions, and iron deficiency.
ingredients.usages: Constipation, skin conditions, anemia, liver support
ingredients.safetyClassification: Contains oxalates - avoid in kidney stones; avoid in pregnancy
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Root: 2-4g as decoction. Tincture: 2-4ml 3x daily.

ingredients.title: Yerba Mansa
ingredients.description: A South American stimulant tea used for energy and weight management.
ingredients.usages: Fatigue, weight management, mental clarity, depression
ingredients.safetyClassification: Contains caffeine; hot consumption linked to esophageal cancer risk
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Tea: 3-5g per cup. Avoid very hot temperatures.

ingredients.usages: Fatigue, weight management, mental clarity, depression

ingredients.title: Yerba Santa
ingredients.description: A California herb used for respiratory conditions and as an expectorant.
ingredients.usages: Coughs, asthma, bronchitis, colds, allergies
ingredients.safetyClassification: Generally safe; limited safety data
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Dried leaf: 2-4g as tea. Tincture: 2-4ml 3x daily.

ingredients.title: Yohimbe Shreds
ingredients.description: An African bark used for erectile dysfunction. Potent and potentially dangerous.
ingredients.usages: Erectile dysfunction, libido, weight loss
ingredients.safetyClassification: DANGEROUS - causes hypertension, anxiety, tachycardia; many drug interactions; prescription in some countries
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Professional supervision required. Standardized yohimbine: 5-10mg under medical guidance.

ingredients.title: Young Birch
ingredients.description: Birch bark and leaves used for urinary complaints, skin conditions, and pain.
ingredients.usages: UTIs, kidney stones, arthritis, skin conditions, gout
ingredients.activeConstituents: Betulin, betulinic acid, salicylates, flavonoids, tannins
ingredients.safetyClassification: Avoid with aspirin allergy; may increase urination
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Leaf tea: 2-4g per cup, 3-4x daily. Bark decoction: 1-2g.

ingredients.title: Za'atar Mix (Thyme
ingredients.description: A culinary herb with powerful antimicrobial and expectorant properties.
ingredients.usages: Coughs, bronchitis, sore throat, digestive complaints, infections
ingredients.safetyClassification: Generally safe; avoid large doses in pregnancy; essential oil potent
ingredients.dosageGuidelines: Dried herb: 1-4g as tea. Tincture: 2-4ml 3x daily. Essential oil: diluted topically.
